users.description: Geologist, likes the great outdoors, the countryside, landscape & nature, acoustic rock & Americana. Values education and integrity. Supports @CPRE#

users.name: Gill Rimmer
users.description: Environment Agency Fleet Technical Team Leader... supporting our colleagues in creating a better place for people and wildlife. Views are my own.

tweets.text:
£100k #GetFishing Fund to benefit new anglers!

The @EnvAgency and @AnglingTrust have announced a new £100k ‘Get Fishing Fund’ to encourage more people to give fishing a go for the first time or get back into angling after a break from the sport.

👉 https://t.co/pPxcFI9tzj https://t.co/ugisKpKhLx

tweets.text: Out in #Warwick this morning with Rich clearing debris from our trash screens and checking hotspot areas following the rain over the weekend #WinterReady #Flood @EnvAgencyMids @EnvAgency @Warwick_DC https://t.co/U55NvrVZy2

We are delighted to announce our 'Bringing the Limestone Becks back to Life' project on the lower Branston Beck has been awarded a grant from the  #GreenRecoveryChallengeFund 
A great project that will transform this section of the beck for people and wildlife #lovelincsrivers https://t.co/CiT8EBaSa4
@EnvAgencySE @CanalRiverTrust - reported already. This is the eel passage at Lea Bridge Road E5 weir. It has come loose from concrete fittings. Are you going to do anything?? https://t.co/NyfbQ5ljmD

The @AnglingTrust & @EnvAgency have launched a new fund to encourage more people to give fishing a go.Funding is available to angling clubs,coaches & fisheries but also to schools, local authorities or charities: https://t.co/WQYivYKMzW @VoluntaryImpact @NorthantsCF @LONorthants https://t.co/j1KbxkvacR

tweets.text: @hauntedbastard @EnvAgency It's a towpath, not open to the public to drive on. Just contractors, lock staff and the two families that live there are the only ones the wayleave agreement stipulates can use it. As there is heavy plant moving about currently, dismounting briefly surely is the safest option ?

Well now everyone agrees with us #cowboys @viridor_dunbar and others finally getting found out dealing with hazardous and non hazardous infectious waste through plants not designed to deal with it @EnvAgency @scottishepa all involved in @scotgov @ukgov @coverups all illegal #scum https://t.co/cMzCYITYg0

tweets.text: Monitoring #NFM benefits of tree planting and enhanced floodplain storage on Lowther Estate showcased by @ITVBorder on Friday. Thanks to our partner @lowthercastle and our funders @EnvAgencyNW and @UKRI_News (@NERC_QNFM). Watch: https://t.co/xdYUmfh5px https://t.co/H6Rw39T8Em

First beaver dam in Cumbria for 400 years @lowthercastle gets new discharge and storage monitoring to show #NFM benefits. Thank you @EnvAgencyNW for funding, and @ITVBorder for reporting. ITV News report and video:  https://t.co/75ehRa7hAx https://t.co/IUzbxaG0pn

@Thisisfelpham @ArunDistrict Viridor don't have a clue how to run an incinerator, in the very short time they have been burning waste, they've had a major fire, their sorting hall is overflowing in hazardous clinical waste (during COVID pandemic) & they fail to meet environment agency permit conditions. https://t.co/2Oq99bDWcH

urls.title: River Thames Conditions
urls.description: Welcome to the Environment Agency's online River Thames conditions update service which displays our current advice to river users. We display warning boards at our locks to inform river users of conditions that may make navigating difficult and dangerous. This page shows our current advice for each reach of the river between Cricklade and Teddington. We will update this information regularly when warning boards are being displayed at locks and as river conditions change. Upstream of St John's Lock No

tweets.text: We're mounting a wide-ranging investigation into reports of damage to the #RiverLugg, which is protected through SSSI status. We're treating this very seriously, working with @NaturalEngland & @ForestryComm who have taken immediate action to prevent any further works at the site. https://t.co/bvhnTETfal
We are proud to announce that Land & Water has saved 75% of the #constructioncarbon and 72% #wholelifecarbon working with @EnvAgency at #Calstock in South East #Cornwall.👏 https://t.co/BHxeFz8qFC

Reducing emissions is essential. Preparing for the effects of the climate emergency is just as crucial.

Today the UK has set out its approach to adaptation – the EA is playing an important part.

https://t.co/6kENDdhMOr

#TogetherForOurPlanet #ClimateAction https://t.co/GlkiKnYCam

tweets.text: #climateemergency impacts, like heatwaves & floods, are rising. The #racetonetzero is essential, but we also need to prepare for new extremes. We need a #racetoresilience. The UK’s adaptation communication is here: https://t.co/TD2YAGoD5n #TogetherForOurPlanet https://t.co/zJ7wfc02Ed

Take action now. Sign up for flood warnings https://t.co/SAcXCY1NKC

tweets.text:
@FoeCambridge @lewis_herbert @greenarteries @Feargal_Sharkey @TerryMac999 @markrwilliamson @dottymcl @BBCCambs @CambsCC @wre @GreaterCambs @EnvAgency @DefraUK @cllrbridget @ab4scambs @OliviaRudgard @camcitco @cllrkatie @DanielZeichner @SouthCambs @mhclg @DefraGovUK Net zero carbon is one thing, but (conveniently?) ignores #water.

We are in a #ClimateEmergency, but also a #NatureEmergency.

Water is the basis of life. Without it our ecosystems collapse.

We need Net Zero Water too. https://t.co/jGkUPXGes5
